title: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2016  Chianti
description: This has scorched earth, tobacco and dark fruit aromas. The simple palate offers black plum and star anise hints alongside laid-back tannins. Drink soon.

title: Warwick 2017 The First Lady Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: Medium-intense aromas of freshly dried grass, orange peel and tart melon rind dance on the nose of this attractive white. The palate shows a bit of roundness that's kept in check by ample acidity and a slightly astringent citrus-pith character. Drink now.

title: Yealands 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine shows grass, melon rind, citrus, guava, and green bell pepper. The palate puts forth just a smidgeon of citrus fruit, but mostly it's green and lean, with a whisper of textural weight that increase its interest slightly.

title: Arndt 2015 Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Candied violets, strawberry frosting, red licorice and sweet leather make for a very inviting, albeit rich, nose to this bottling. The palate confirms those sweet ripe tones, with concentrated fruit-punch and watermelon flavors that are cut by tangy plum skins and good acidity.

title: Atwater 2014 Moffett Block Blaufränkisch (Finger Lakes)
description: A briar patch of strawberry and blackberry makes for a sharp, raspy nose, with a light sheen of oak. The medium-bodied palate is juicy in profile, boasting bramble berry and cranberry flavors under a toasty veil and medium-grained tannins.

title: Benmarl 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Aromas of tart candies, grapefruits and soapy florals make for a heady nose. This is light in feel, with a palate that transitions from lemon to red apple and finally grapefruit pith on the finish.

title: Berryhill 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit and dried herbs meet flavors that are earthy and herbal in this medium-bodied lively assertive wine.

title: Brazin 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Intense smoky, meaty aromas lead to thick toast and spice flavors in this full-bodied and very oaky wine. Moderate berry flavors and medium tannins lie underneath the oak.

title: Ca' Ronesca 2016 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: This has subtle aromas suggesting white spring flowers and citrus zest. The bright, simple palate evokes grapefruit, sage and a hint of beeswax.

title: Carson Scott 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is smooth enough to sip easily but still has some supportive tannins and good acidity for balance. It smells like raspberries and thyme and tastes quite fruity.

title: Château de Marsan 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Immediately perfumed, this wine is crisp, spicy and with great acidity. Its ripe character is enhanced by lemon and gooseberry flavors as well as nutmeg and a rich aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château de Saint-Martin 2017 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Very pale in color, this wine adds the Tibouren grape to the more usual mix of Cinsault and Grenache. That brings an herbal element to the wine and adds extra freshness. With the bright texture and fruitiness, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Château la Tour de l'Evêque 2017 Vendanges Manuelles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Owned by the Sumeire family, this estate has produced a ripe and soft style of rosé. It misses out on crispness but does have plenty of rich strawberry flavors. The aftertaste is warm and rounded. Drink now.

title: Columbia Winery 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Lighter in color, the aromas bring unusual notes of seaweed, cherry, wet penny and exotic spice. The palate is full of ripe raspberry and red-cherry flavors with a short finish. If the aromas and flavors sync up, it might move up a notch or two.

title: Divum 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Very shy on the aromas, this bottling slowly reveals hints of key lime pith. There is decent texture and bright acidity on the palate, which is clean but only shows hints of a citrus flavor.

title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2017 Breezette Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A soft, spicy style of rosé, this wine is full of ripe berries with a lightly smoky character. It finishes with a crisper, red-currant aftertaste. Drink this ripe wine now.

title: Altvs 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is intense in acidity, with a severity that takes time to resolve. The oak is dusted in vanilla, adding to an inherent richness of lemon meringue and brioche.

title: Aluvé 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas and flavors bring notes of sliced green pepper, cherry, herb and baking spice. There's interest but it all doesn't seem fully ripe and the concentration appears a bit light.

title: Bianchi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: There's a struck-match flinty quality to the first sniff of this wine, and then come the lemon skins and dried Granny Smith apples. It's much cleaner on the palate, full of tangy lime and pome fruits.

title: Billsboro 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: A straightforward nose of lemon, grapefruit and a touch of plastic make for an easy, yet enjoyable wine. Light in body, with a mildly round texture, the palate brings a crisp vein of gooseberry and green apple flavor.

title: Board Track Racer 2015 The Shift Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is mostly Syrah (88%) finished off with Mourvèdre. Unusual, not entirely appealing aromas of barbeque sauce, smoked ribs and medicine cabinet lead to flat-seeming fruit flavors.

title: Burnt Bridge 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: With fruit coming from Les Collines Vineyard, aromas of green pepper, tire rubber, baking spice and cherry are followed by slightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. Soft tannins provide support. It doesn't all come together.

title: Château Barbanau 2017 L'Instant Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is fruity, spicy with a line of acidity and crisp red fruits. Produced from organically grown grapes, it is immediately attractive, light and bright to drink.

title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2017 White (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is an herbal-flavored wine, dominated by Rolle and Sauvignon Blanc. Green apple and citrus flavors partner with bright acidity and a lively, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Delfosse 2016 Mountain and Vine Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)
description: Aromas of mango, passion fruit, gooseberry and geranium show on the nose. The tropical notes follow through to the palate, but are muted by a briny salinity. This would be a nice wine to sip outside while eating soft shelled crab.

title: Fire Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Although it has little of the grassy and green vegetal characters of many Marlborough Sauvignon Blancs, this wine still ticks many stylistic boxes. It's aromatic and outgoing—a heaping fruit bowl of pineapple, passionfruit, guava and grapefruit. There's a slight oiliness to the palate, which makes for some welcome texture amidst prickly acidity and plenty more exotic fruit flavors.

title: Fontella 2016  Chianti
description: This informal red opens with dark fruit and baking spice aromas that carry over to the simple palate, along with a clove note and round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Glen Manor 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc has a tropical nose, full of overripe melon, passionfruit, fresh grapefruit and button mushroom. The flavors are similar and there is also a nice salinity to the palate. Easy drinking from ample acidity, this would be a great summer salad accompaniment.

title: Goldwater 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There is a strong onion aroma here that blows off, allowing aromas of grapefruit, guava, snow pea and tomato leaf come to the fore. Texturally, it's a little lean and mean with mouthpuckering acidity. There's a nice herbal edge on the palate but its lacking in fruit.

title: Gravel Bar 2015 Alluvial Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (35%), Merlot (30%), Cabernet Franc (15%), Malbec and Petit Verdot make up this wine. Aromas of ripe black currant, cigar box, dried herb and black cherry are followed by lightly sweet, smoky fruit flavors. It brings a tacky feel.
